name: Morrisville Scrap Processing Company, Inc., Appellant, v. Commonwealth of Pennsylvania
name_abbreviation: Morrisville Scrap Processing Co. v. Commonwealth

judges: Before Jones, O. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and ManDERINO, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Jones and Mr. Justice O’Brien note a dissent
parties: Morrisville Scrap Processing Company, Inc., Appellant, v. Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Order affirmed. See Commonwealth v. Deitch Company, 149 Pa. 88, 295 A. 2d 834 (1972); Commonwealth v. Life Assurance Company of Pennsylvania, 419 Pa. 370, 214 A. 2d 209 (1965); Commonwealth v. Lafferty, 426 Pa. 541, 233 A. 2d 256 (1967); Ott v. Mississippi Valley Barge Line Company, 336 U.S. 169, 69 S. Ct. 432 (1949); and Wisconsin v. J. C. Penney Co., 311 U.S. 435, 61 S. Ct. 246 (1940).
Mr. Chief Justice Jones and Mr. Justice O’Brien note a dissent
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Howard Could, with him Lewis H. Markowitz, Could, Reichert & Stranss, and Markowitz, Kagen & Griffith, for appellant.
Edward T. Baker, Deputy Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Morrisville Scrap Processing Company, Inc., Appellant, v. Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 22, 1973.
Before Jones, O. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy, Nix and ManDERINO, JJ.
reargument refused August 8, 1973.
Howard Could, with him Lewis H. Markowitz, Could, Reichert & Stranss, and Markowitz, Kagen & Griffith, for appellant.
Edward T. Baker, Deputy Attorney General, for Commonwealth, appellee.
July 2, 1973:
